place.name: TROWELL
place.gazetteerText: TROWELL, a parish, with a village, in Basford district, Notts; 1 mile N of Stanton-Gate r. station, and 5½ W of Nottingham. It has a post-office under Nottingham. Acres, 1,570. Real property, £2,425. Pop., 343. Houses, 63. The manor belongs to Lord Middleton. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £440.* Patron, Lord Middleton. The church was repaired in 1835. There is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
